Context:
Program Name: Advanced Manufacturing
Code: T414
Credential: Ontario College Graduate Certificate
Duration: 1 year - 2 semesters
Starting Months: January, September
Domestic Tuition: $6,803.00
International Tuition: $18,657.00
Method of Study: Full-time
Location: Casa Loma Campus
Program Offerings: Fall 2024 (Open for domestic and international students), Winter 2025 (Open for domestic students, opens Apr 8, 2024 for international students), Spring 2025 (Not Available)
Centre: Construction & Engineering Technologies
School: Mechanical Engineering Technologies
Program Description: Hands-on instruction in safe working, machining skills, machine programming, part inspection, and precision measurement. Suitable for full-time workers, recent engineering/trades graduates, international professionals, and industry professionals with relevant certifications.
Experiential Learning: Several courses are experientially based in a machine shop where students practice advanced precision machining skills.
Program Outcomes: After completing the certificate, students will be able to program, set up, and use advanced manufacturing equipment and know how to fabricate and build a progressive stamping die-set using conventional tools and advanced machinery.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Advanced Manufacturing Program T414 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
The text provides information about a college program focused on fabricating and building progressive stamping die-sets using conventional tools and advanced manufacturing equipment like CNC metal-cutting machines. The program offers flexible learning options for those working full-time. As a graduate, potential career opportunities include roles such as CNC Operator, CNC Programmer, Technical Sales Representative, CNC Machinist, CNC Setup-Operator, General Machinist, and Tool Designer. Employers in this industry are primarily manufacturers, particularly in fabricated metal, machinery, motor vehicle parts, and aerospace manufacturing.

Required courses for the first semester include CADE 1013 (CNC Machining Practices), EMNG 1004 (Metrology), MENG 1041 (Tool Fabrication), MENG 1042 (Engineering Drawing and Mechanical CAD), MENG 1043 (CNC Programming), and MENG 1088 (Occupational Health and Safety). The second semester courses are CADE 2013 (Advanced Computer-Aided Manufacturing), CADE 2034 (Advanced CNC Machining), DRFT 2024 (Tool Design), MENG 2041 (Precision Tool Manufacturing), and MENG 2061 (Career Preparation).

The graduate will be able to assemble and analyze information, collaborate with team members, analyze and solve manufacturing problems, interpret and modify technical documents, and contribute to production processes. They must comply with standard operating procedures, health and safety legislation, and organizational practices to ensure safety.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Advanced Manufacturing Program T414 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context: The College offers a Mechanical Engineering program. The tuition fees for domestic students are $6,803.00 for the first two semesters starting in Fall 2023. The tuition fees for international students are $18,657.00 for the first two semesters starting in Fall 2024. Additional costs, which do not include books, are also estimated to be paid by the student. OSAP funding is approved for this program, but applicants must meet OSAP eligibility criteria. Admission requirements include an Ontario College Diploma, Ontario College Advanced Diploma, Degree or equivalent in Mechanical Engineering or Mechanical Engineering Technology. International students who do not provide English language proficiency test results must take the George Brown College English assessment to be considered for admission. Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges, while international students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System. For more information, students can contact the School of Mechanical Engineering.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Advanced Manufacturing Program T414 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context: To apply for a program at George Brown College, use the Online Application System. For general information about the college, call 416-415-2000 (TTY 1-877-515-5559) or 1-800-265-2002. International students can contact a recruitment representative through booking a virtual meeting or submitting an inquiry on the International Contact Us page. Campus tours and information sessions can be booked, and applicants can sign up to receive tailored resources for their application process. Interested individuals should provide their first name, last name, email address, domestic or international status, and country in order to sign up for information and learn more about the college's options and programs.
